qas.question: What did the foundation announce in March 2006

answers.text: n March 2006, the foundation announced a US$5 million grant for the International Justice Mission (IJM)

qas.question: What is the International Justice Mission

answers.text: a human rights organization based in Washington, D.C., US to work in the area of sex trafficking.

qas.question: What would the grant allow the IJM to do

answers.text: the grant would allow the IJM to "create a replicable model for combating sex trafficking and slavery

qas.question: What did the office that ijm opened do specifically

answers.text: conducting undercover investigations, training law enforcement, rescuing victims, ensuring appropriate aftercare, and seeking perpetrator accountability".

qas.question: How much was the grant for the IJM for working in the area of training law enforcement?
What is the name of the undercover investigation organization based in Washington DC?

plausible_answers.text: create a replicable model for combating sex trafficking and slavery

qas.question: What will the foundation office use the grant for?
What does the area of the foundation organization have high rates of?
Where is the IJM as a law enforcement organization based?

context: I<a0_0>n March 2006, the foundation announced a <b4_0>US$5 million grant<b4_0/> for the <b5_0>International Justice Mission (IJM)<b5_0/><a0_0/>, <a1_0>a human rights organization based in <b8_0>Washington, D.C.<b8_0/>, US to work in the area of sex trafficking.<a1_0/> The official announcement explained that <a2_0>the grant would allow the IJM to "<b6_0>create a replicable model for combating sex trafficking and slavery<b6_0/><a2_0/>" that would involve the opening of an office in a region with high rates of <b7_0>sex trafficking<b7_0/>, following research. The office was opened for three years for the following purposes: "<a3_0>conducting undercover investigations, training law enforcement, rescuing victims, ensuring appropriate aftercare, and seeking perpetrator accountability".
